name: Maine National Guard 100% Tuition Waiver
description: Maine National Guard members receive 100% tuition waiver at ANY Maine state postsecondary institution (University of Maine System, Maine Community College System, Maine Maritime Academy). Full-time or part-time enrollment. Use for one credential: bachelor's, associate, OR certificate/licensure. Up to 130 credit hours. Must exhaust other benefits first (federal TA, employer tuition, Pell Grant). Does NOT include books, housing, lab fees, or mandatory fees.
eligibility: Maine National Guard member (Army or Air)
Exhaust federal TA, employer tuition, Pell Grant first
benefit_amount: 100% tuition waiver (up to 130 credit hours, one credential)
how_to_apply: Contact Maine National Guard Education Office (207) 430-5922 or ng.me.arng.list.j1-esos@mail.mil. Deadline: July 31 (Fall), November 30 (Spring)

name: 100% Tuition Waiver for Dependents of Disabled/Deceased Veterans
description: Dependents (children and spouses) of Maine veterans who are permanently and totally disabled, missing in action, died of service-connected disability, OR killed in action receive 100% waiver of tuition AND fees at Maine state schools. Veteran must have entered service from Maine OR been Maine resident for 5 years before application. Veteran (if living) must continue Maine residency during benefit use.
eligibility: Child or spouse of Maine veteran
Veteran: 100% P&T disabled, MIA, died service-connected, OR KIA
Veteran entered service from Maine OR 5-year resident before application
benefit_amount: 100% tuition + fees waiver at Maine state schools
how_to_apply: Apply through Maine State Approving Agency for Veterans Education
source_name: Maine Department of Defense, Veterans and Emergency Management

name: In-State Tuition for Military and Veterans
description: In-state tuition rates available for active duty service members, veterans, and dependents at Maine public institutions under federal Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act.
eligibility: Active duty service member OR veteran OR dependent
how_to_apply: Contact Maine institution financial aid office

name: Veteran Property Tax Exemption ($6,000)
description: Maine resident veterans eligible for $6,000 property tax exemption if: age 62+ AND served during federally recognized war period OR received Armed Forces Expeditionary Medal OR receiving 100% VA disability OR became 100% disabled while serving. Unremarried surviving spouses also eligible. File once - automatically continues unless homestead changes.
how_to_apply: Apply to local Assessor's Office by April 1 (one-time application)

name: Paraplegic Veteran Property Tax Exemption ($50,000)
description: Paraplegic veterans who received federal VA grant for specially adapted housing unit receive $50,000 property tax exemption. Also available to qualifying spouses.
eligibility: Received federal VA grant for specially adapted housing
how_to_apply: Apply to local Assessor's Office by April 1 with VA grant documentation

name: Property Tax Fairness Credit (Expanded for Veterans 2022)
description: In 2022, Maine Legislature enacted expanded benefit for veterans through Property Tax Fairness Credit. While based on property tax paid, administered through individual income tax return. Provides additional property tax relief beyond exemptions.
benefit_amount: Income tax credit based on property taxes paid (amount varies)
how_to_apply: Claim on Maine individual income tax return (Form 1040ME)

name: Motor Vehicle Excise Tax Exemption (100% Disabled)
description: Veterans receiving benefits based on total service-connected disability exempt from motor vehicle excise tax. Even if not displaying disabled plates.
eligibility: Receiving benefits for total (100%) service-connected disability
benefit_amount: Exempt from motor vehicle excise tax
how_to_apply: Contact Maine Bureau of Veterans' Services

name: Military Pay Tax Exemption (Stationed Out-of-State)
description: Military pay received by Maine resident service member serving active duty OUTSIDE Maine is EXEMPT from Maine state income tax. Military pay for Maine residents stationed IN Maine IS taxable.
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on military pay (if outside Maine)
how_to_apply: Exclude from Maine income tax return

name: Nonresident Military Spouse Income Tax Exemption
description: Eligible nonresident military spouses do NOT have to pay Maine income tax for wages earned in Maine under Military Spouses Residency Relief Act.
eligibility: In Maine solely to be with service member spouse
how_to_apply: File exemption with Maine employer

name: Military Retirement Pay Tax Exemption
description: Maine does NOT tax military retired pay. 100% exempt from Maine state income tax.
how_to_apply: Exclude from Maine income tax return

name: Military Disability Retirement Pay Exemption
description: Military Disability Retirement Pay received as pension, annuity, or similar allowance for personal injury/sickness from active service should NOT be included in Maine taxable income.
how_to_apply: Exclude from Maine income tax return

name: Survivor Benefit Plans Tax Exemption
description: SBP, RCSBP, and RSFPP annuities are NOT taxed in Maine. 100% exempt.
how_to_apply: Exclude from Maine income tax return

name: Combat Zone Pay Tax Exemption
description: Maine follows federal tax rules for combat zone pay. Pay excluded from federal AGI because earned in combat zone also excluded from Maine income tax. Service members who die in terrorist act, combat, or from combat injuries exempt from Maine taxes for year of death - previously paid taxes refunded.
eligibility: Service member serving in combat zone
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on combat zone pay + death year exemption
how_to_apply: Follow federal combat zone exclusion rules on Maine return

name: Combat Zone Filing Extension
description: Deadline for filing Maine income tax returns and paying taxes extended 180 days after: last day of continuous hospitalization for combat zone injury OR last day of qualifying service in combat zone. Extension includes days left to file when entering combat zone.
eligibility: Service member serving in combat zone OR
benefit_amount: 180-day filing/payment extension + days remaining at entry
how_to_apply: Automatic extension applies

name: Veterans Employment Preference (State Jobs)
description: Maine state government provides hiring preference for honorably discharged veterans. Additional consideration for disabled veterans.
how_to_apply: Indicate veteran status on Maine state job applications with DD-214

name: FREE Lifetime Hunting/Fishing License (50%+ Disabled)
description: Maine resident veterans with 50%+ service-connected disability receive FREE license to fish, trap, or hunt (including archery, muzzle-loading, pheasant stamps). License valid for LIFE as long as residency requirements continue.
how_to_apply: Apply through Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife with VA documentation
source_name: Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife

name: Resident Hunting/Fishing Rates for Military
description: Nonresident service members permanently stationed in Maine AND their dependents may purchase Maine hunting, fishing, or trapping licenses at RESIDENT prices.
how_to_apply: Present military ID at Maine Inland Fisheries and Wildlife
source_name: Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife

name: Discounted Hunting/Fishing Licenses (Active Duty + Dependents)
description: Active-duty Maine residents and their dependents can purchase discounted hunting, fishing, or combination hunting-fishing licenses.
eligibility: Maine resident active duty service member OR dependent
how_to_apply: Apply through Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife
source_name: Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife

name: Hunter Safety Course Exemption (Active Duty on Leave)
description: Maine resident active duty service members permanently stationed outside U.S. and home on leave are EXEMPT from hunter, archery, and crossbow safety course requirements.
benefit_amount: Exempt from hunter/archery/crossbow safety course requirements
how_to_apply: Present military ID and leave papers
source_name: Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife

name: Disabled Veterans Controlled Moose Hunt (25 Permits)
description: Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife allocates 25 moose hunting permits to disabled veterans for Controlled Moose Hunt in Aroostook County. Once-in-a-lifetime hunting opportunity.
benefit_amount: 25 moose hunting permits allocated (Aroostook County, one-time)
how_to_apply: Apply through Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife
source_name: Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife

name: FREE State Parks/Museums/Sites Admission
description: FREE admission to Maine state parks, museums, and sites for: resident veterans (other-than-dishonorable), 100% disabled resident veterans and dependents, Maine resident enlisted active duty members and dependents.
eligibility: Maine resident enlisted active duty + dependents
benefit_amount: FREE admission to state parks, museums, sites
how_to_apply: Present veteran ID or military ID at Maine state facilities
source_name: Maine Bureau of Parks and Lands

name: Special Veteran License Plates
description: Multiple veteran specialty license plate options available for Maine veterans including general veteran plates, disabled veteran plates, and branch-specific plates.
how_to_apply: Apply at Maine Bureau of Motor Vehicles with DD-214

name: Maine Veterans' Memorial Cemetery
description: State veterans cemetery in Augusta. Eligibility same as federal VA cemeteries. FREE burial for eligible Maine veterans and spouses.
how_to_apply: Contact Maine Veterans' Memorial Cemetery in Augusta

name: Pine Tree Legal Assistance
description: FREE legal assistance for Maine military members and veterans through Pine Tree Legal Assistance. Provides civil legal services.
how_to_apply: Contact Pine Tree Legal Assistance
